com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.regex.addons.saxlike

Interface Handler


  • public interface Handler
    By implementing a handler like this, you get informed about matched tokens and the text between matched tokens (so-called noMatches), i.e about the entire content of the stream. The noMatches may come in chunks if the character buffer window of the used RegexModifier is smaller than the entire text between two tokens.

    If you are familiar with SAX, you can compare this handler with a SAX handler.

    EXAMPLE: RangeFilterHandler, TODO more examples

    Since:
    1.1.0
    Author:
    rwoo

    • Method Detail

      • processToken

        MatchProcessorResult processToken(Token token,
                                  StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                                  int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                                  MatchResult matchResult)
        The method is allowed to modify the stream. Very similar to the method with the same name in TokenProcessor.
        Returns:
        Returns null if the default processor of the token shall be applied.

      • processNoMatch

        MatchResult processNoMatch(int startPosition,
                           StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                           int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                           MatchResult matchResult)
        NoMatch.processNoMatch(StringBuilder, int, MatchResult) describes how the end of the noMatch can be determined from the method parameters.
        Returns:
        Returns null if the stream is not modified. Otherwise a match result must be returned that is still valid for the modified stream. If you insert or remove characters before the match MatchResultShifted helps you.

      • processNoMatch

        AfterModification processNoMatch(int startPosition,
                                 StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                                 int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                                 boolean endOfStreamHit,
                                 AfterModification mod,
                                 Modifier modifier)
        NoMatch.processNoMatch(StringBuilder, int, boolean, AfterModification, Modifier) describes how the end of the noMatch can be determined from the method parameters.
        Returns:
        Returns null if the stream is not modified.
